I apologize for any confusion. Of the medications listed for the patient, Cymbalta (duloxetine) is the primary one associated with an increased risk of serotonin syndrome.

Cymbalta (duloxetine) is a selective serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI), which increases the levels of serotonin and norepinephrine in the synaptic cleft by inhibiting their reuptake. This increase in serotonin levels can potentially contribute to serotonin syndrome, especially when combined with other medications that affect serotonin levels.

While the other medications listed do not significantly contribute to the risk of serotonin syndrome on their own, it is essential to monitor the patient closely and educate them on the signs and symptoms of serotonin syndrome. This is especially important when adding or adjusting any medications that may have serotonergic effects.
